question.text:
The following are some statements about leucocytes. Which of these is incorrect?

I. The most abundant leucocyte is a granulocyte, whereas the least abundant leucocyte is an agranulocyte.
II. The largest leucocyte is a granulocyte, whereas the smallest leucocyte is an agranulocyte.
III. Phagocytic leucocytes may be agranulocyte or granulocyte.
IV. Polymorphonuclear leucocytes are the largest granulocyte, whereas the largest agranulocyte has a kidney-shaped nucleus.

solution.text: The most abundant leucocyte (neutrophil) is a granulocyte, whereas the least abundant leucocyte (basophil) is also a granulocyte. The largest leucocyte (monocyte) is an agranulocyte, whereas the smallest leucocyte (lymphocyte) is also an agranulocyte. Phagocytic leucocytes are neutrophils (granulocyte) and monocyte (agranulocyte). Polymorphonuclear leucocytes (neutrophils) are the largest granulocytes, whereas the largest agranulocyte (monocyte) has a kidney shaped nucleus.
